title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement Athanasia Mo Mowinckel. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Getting started with Neuromat
text: create qdec object, use make_fs_qdec function, formula data. formula decides variables qdec file contain, binarise levels factors, scale continuous variables mean 0 standard deviation 1. Make sure include -1 remove intercept, make sure factors levels represented qdec file. include -1, model expose levels factors, capture first levels factor Intercept consist value 1. -1 makes sure get qdec expected Freesurfer documentation

title: Getting started with Neuromat
text: can keep original data qdec file using keep argument. useful want keep original data reference, want use qdec file purposes just running model. default, keep FALSE, switching TRUE keep original data columns model. recommended also base-id’s data column, can also request qdec using id-column’s name keep argument. can also character vector, let’s specify columns keep.
code: make_fs_qdec(cars, mpg ~ -1 + cyl + hp, keep = TRUE) #>                   cyl4 cyl6 cyl8       mpgz        hpz  mpg cyl  hp #> Mazda RX4            0    1    0  0.1508848 -0.5350928 21.0   6 110 #> Mazda RX4 Wag        0    1    0  0.1508848 -0.5350928 21.0   6 110 #> Datsun 710           1    0    0  0.4495434 -0.7830405 22.8   4  93 #> Hornet 4 Drive       0    1    0  0.2172534 -0.5350928 21.4   6 110 #> Hornet Sportabout    0    0    1 -0.2307345  0.4129422 18.7   8 175 #> Valiant              0    1    0 -0.3302874 -0.6080186 18.1   6 105 #> Duster 360           0    0    1 -0.9607889  1.4339030 14.3   8 245 #> Merc 240D            1    0    0  0.7150178 -1.2351802 24.4   4  62 #> Merc 230             1    0    0  0.4495434 -0.7538702 22.8   4  95 #> Merc 280             0    1    0 -0.1477738 -0.3454858 19.2   6 123 #> Merc 280C            0    1    0 -0.3800638 -0.3454858 17.8   6 123 #> Merc 450SE           0    0    1 -0.6123539  0.4858679 16.4   8 180 #>  [ title: Getting started with Neuromat
text: Visualise qdec file plot function. good way confirm expect data look like.
code: qdec <- make_fs_qdec(cars,                       mpg ~ -1 + cyl + hp + gear) plot(qdec)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Athanasia Mo Mowinckel. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation

code: @Manual{,   title = {neuromat: Create Model Matrices for Neuroimaging Analyses},   author = {Athanasia Mo Mowinckel},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000, http://www.capro.dev/neuromat/},   url = {https://github.com/capro-uio/neuromat}, }

what: Create Model Matrices for Neuroimaging Analyses
title: Create Model Matrices for Neuroimaging Analyses
text: Running vertex-wise linear mixed effects models Freesurfer requires specific file format. qdec format requires neatly created binary columns categorical value levels, made efficient continuous variables scaled (de-meaned). package provides functions create files R.

title: Create Model Matrices for Neuroimaging Analyses
text: can install development version neuromat like :

title: Create Model Matrices for Neuroimaging Analyses
code: library(neuromat) cars <- mtcars cars$cyl <- factor(cars$cyl) cars$gear <- factor(cars$gear) qdec <- make_fs_qdec(cars, mpg ~ -1 + cyl + hp) qdec #>                   cyl4 cyl6 cyl8       mpgz        hpz #> Mazda RX4            0    1    0  0.1508848 -0.5350928 #> Mazda RX4 Wag        0    1    0  0.1508848 -0.5350928 #> Datsun 710           1    0    0  0.4495434 -0.7830405 #> Hornet 4 Drive       0    1    0  0.2172534 -0.5350928 #> Hornet Sportabout    0    0    1 -0.2307345  0.4129422 #> Valiant              0    1    0 -0.3302874 -0.6080186 #> Duster 360           0    0    1 -0.9607889  1.4339030 #> Merc 240D            1    0    0  0.7150178 -1.2351802 #> Merc 230             1    0    0  0.4495434 -0.7538702 #> Merc 280             0    1    0 -0.1477738 -0.3454858 #> Merc 280C            0    1    0 -0.3800638 -0.3454858 #> Merc 450SE           0    0    1 -0.6123539  0.4858679 #>  [ reached 'max' / getOption("max.print") -- omitted 20 rows ]  plot(qdec)

title: Create a Freesurfer qdec — make_fs_qdec
text: Create Freesurfer qdec model formula, utilising R's robust model formula syntax. function also scales continuous variables, can keep original data output.

title: Create a Freesurfer qdec — make_fs_qdec
code: make_fs_qdec(data, formula, path = NULL, keep = FALSE)

title: Create a Freesurfer qdec — make_fs_qdec
text: data data.frame, list environment containing data. Neither matrix array accepted. formula model formula terms object. simple qdec file, binary columns levels factor, make sure include formula -1 remove intercept. path option file path write qdec csv keep logical vector column names, keep original data output. Default FALSE.

title: Create a Freesurfer qdec — make_fs_qdec
text: data.frame model matrix scaled continuous variables.

title: Create a Freesurfer qdec — make_fs_qdec
text: formula likelihood also include -1 remove intercept, provide matrix levels factor variables binary column. necessary follow steps Freesurfer documentation. highly recommended base-id's Freesurfer column, request remain qdec using id-column's name keep argument.

title: Plot qdec matrix — plot.qdec
text: Visualise Freesurfer qdec matrix returned byt make_fs_qdec function.

title: Plot qdec matrix — plot.qdec
code: # S3 method for qdec plot(x, col = hcl.colors(12, "viridis"), ...)

title: Plot qdec matrix — plot.qdec
text: x qdec object col vector colors used heatmap. ... arguments passed heatmap. scale, Rowv, Colv already custom values may overwritten sake better visualisation.

title: Plot qdec matrix — plot.qdec
text: heatmap qdec matrix

title: Plot qdec matrix — plot.qdec
code: cars <- mtcars cars$cyl <- as.factor(cars$cyl)  qdec <- make_fs_qdec(cars, mpg ~ -1 + cyl + hp) plot(qdec)

title: Freesurfer qdec constructor — qdec
text: Creates qdec matrix model formula.

title: Freesurfer qdec constructor — qdec
text: data input data.frame formula model formula terms object. simple qdec file, binary columns levels factor, make sure include formula -1 remove intercept.

title: Freesurfer qdec constructor — qdec
text: qdec model matrix

title: Freesurfer qdec constructor — qdec
code: cars <- mtcars cars$cyl <- as.factor(cars$cyl)  qdec <- qdec(cars, mpg ~ cyl + hp)

title: Scale a numeric vector — scale_vec
text: Scale numeric vector

title: Scale a numeric vector — scale_vec
text: x numeric vector scale ... additional arguments passed scale

title: Scale a numeric vector — scale_vec
text: scaled vector
